page.title: 14HOME LIFE IN N-E LEICS
page.content: Most families in the area live a very quiet rural way of life with farming activities taking up many hours per day despite modern methods and mechanical aids. Many houses have central heating using either oil or solid fuel. Some rely on open fires of logs or coal while others have electric fires. Cooking is by electricity, bottled gas, or solid fuel, with most families having at least one cooked meal a day.A freezer is an essential piece of kitchen equipment with some families freezing their own produce, however most farmers do not have a vegetable garden. All homes have a telephone which is considered essential and mail is delivered daily.Post is collected from roadside boxes. Most families keep pets, cats and dogs being the most popular.
